head.title: Toward Better Care for the Old

hedline.hl1: Toward Better Care for the Old

abstract.p: Letter from James L Wilkes II, lawyer who represents victims of nursing home abuse, says nursing home industry is plagued with fraud and mismanagement and Congress must change Medicare rules to make institutionalized nursing care an option of last resort (Aug 7 editorial)

Re ''Acceptable Nursing Care'' (editorial, Aug. 7): The for-profit nursing home industry is plagued with fraud and mismanagement. Operators have been repeatedly found guilty of stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from taxpayers while providing substandard care. Isn't it time we accept that warehousing the elderly in institutional settings is a failed experiment?

Congress must change the Medicare rules to allow families real long-term care options. We need to move toward community-based care systems like small group homes, adult foster care and home help programs. We can save taxpayers money, allow the elderly to age with dignity and make institutionalized nursing care an option of last resort.
JAMES L. WILKES II Tampa, Fla., Aug. 8, 2000
The writer is a lawyer who represents victims of nursing home abuse.
